content.raw:
In the interest of historical records, I think I understand what confused me.  That is, if I do this sequence:  start a random world, wait until I'm clearly harnessed, and then command to start task 2, checkpoint 3, the robot correctly moves.

It *also* correctly sets a harness status right away, but there are no corresponding messages on the terminal.  So if you look at the terminal output, you think, 'hey, I can send messages', and if you send walking commands while in the harness, then that seems to bollix things up such that the harness never detects the lowering, and you're stuck.
content.html:
In the interest of historical records, I think I understand what confused me. That is, if I do this sequence: start a random world, wait until I'm clearly harnessed, and then command to start task 2, checkpoint 3, the robot correctly moves.

It also correctly sets a harness status right away, but there are no corresponding messages on the terminal. So if you look at the terminal output, you think, 'hey, I can send messages', and if you send walking commands while in the harness, then that seems to bollix things up such that the harness never detects the lowering, and you're stuck.
